author: Staff Reporter
text:
The 5{+t}{+h}Pillar, an NGO that fights corruption, has asked candidates of various political parities to assure electors that they would bring Lokayukta, Right to Service Act, take action against persons who were caught in corruption cases and also will not give money or material to electors for getting votes.

Addressing reporters, coordinator Rasamanickam said that corruption-free society in the State would be their main focus during the ensuring Assembly elections. He wanted the candidates of various political parties to give the four promises during their election campaigns.

He demanded bringing of Lokayukta so that right from workers at the lower level to the Chief Minister can be prosecuted if they receive bribe apart from seizing their property. The Right to Service Act that stipulated time-frame delivery of service to the people should be implemented for the welfare of society at large. The coordinator wanted persons who were caught red-handed for accepting bribe to be brought before the law and punishment handed over within six months. “The law should be amended accordingly.”

He also wanted the candidates to assure that they would not bribe the electors either with money or property. Members also distributed awareness pamphlets.
title: ‘Assure voters graft-free society’
